text: Voronezh State Agricultural University () is a public university located in Voronezh, Russia. == History == The university was founded in 1912 by decree of Nicholas II as the Voronezh Agricultural Institute. It was named after Peter I. The grand opening took place in 1913. In 1930 the institute was reorganized. In 1991 it was renamed into Voronezh Agricultural University.VSAU history == Structure == * Agroengineering Faculty * Faculty of land management and cadastres * Faculty of Humanities and Law * Faculty of Agronomy, Agrochemistry and Ecology * Faculty of Veterinary Medicine and Animal Husbandry Technology * Faculty of Technology and Commodity Science * Faculty of EconomicsVSAU structure == References == == Bibliography == * ==Other websites== * Voronezh State Agricultural University Category:Voronezh Category:Colleges and universities in Russia Category:1912 establishments in Asia Category:1912 establishments in Europe Category:1910s establishments in Russia Category:Agricultural organizations
title: Voronezh State Agricultural University
